[ S or U ] (a way of) being saved from danger, loss, or harm: After the diagnosis, getting to know Mary was his salvation. a marriage beyond salvation
[ U ] In the Christian religion, salvation of a person or their spirit is the state of being saved from evil and its effects by the death of Jesus on a cross: The Gospel message is one of personal salvation.

something that prevents danger, loss, or harm: That blanket was my salvation when my car broke down in the snow.
In some religions, salvation is the state of complete belief in God that will save those who believe from the punishment of God for evil or immoral acts.
